content:
Not really code as such, but heres some markdown notes ### Notes Headers # Heading H1 ## Heading H2 ### Heading H3 #### Heading H4 ##### Heading H5 ###### Heading H6 Emphasis _Text_ Displays text in italics **Text** Displays the text in bold **_Text_** Displays the text in bold and italics ~~Text~~ Adds strikethrough effect to the text Lists 1. item1 First ordered list item 2. item2 Second ordered list item ⋅⋅1. Item Ordered sub-list item * Item Unordered list item ⋅⋅* Item Unordered sub-list item Links [text link](https://duckduckgo.com) Inline-style link [text link with title](https://duckduckgo.com "DDG Home") Inline-style link with title [Reference-style link][Arbitrary case-insensitive reference text] Reference style link [Use numbers for reference-style link definitions][1] Displays text in italics **Text** Displays the text in bold **_Text_** Displays the text in bold and italics ~~Text~~ Adds strikethrough effect to the text Lists 1. item1 First ordered list item 1. item2 Second ordered list item 1. Item Ordered sub-list item * Item Unordered list item * Item Unordered sub-list item Links [text link](https://aa-9000.github.io) Inline-style link [text link with title](https://aa-9000.github.io "home") Inline-style link with title [Reference-style link][1] Images ![alt text](images/gopher-404.jpg "Logo Title") Inline style `code` Inline code has back-ticks around it ``` Code blocks ``` Blocks of code are either fenced by lines with three back-ticks or are indented with four spaces Blockquotes > Blockquotes > Inline HTML
    list
You can use the raw HTML in your Markdown Horizontal Rule --- You can get a horizontal rule by typing three or more hyphens (-), asterisks (*) or underscore (_) Links with a reference number. The number needs to be defined as [1]: http://slashdot.org Images ![alt text](https://github.com/n48.png "Logo Title") Inline style [alt text][logo] The reference style. Reference need to be declared as [logo]: https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 2" Code and Syntax Highlighting `code` Inline code has back-ticks around it ``` Code blocks ``` Blocks of code are either fenced by lines with three back-ticks or are indented with four spaces Blockquotes > Blockquotes Blockquotes are very handy in email to emulate reply text Inline HTML
    list
You can use the raw HTML in your Markdown Horizontal Rule --- You can get a horizontal rule by typing three or more hyphens (-), asterisks (*) or underscore (_)

content:
Helm2 - https://helm.sh/docs/faq/changes_since_helm2/#changes-since-helm-2
helm install -n web-app -f values.yaml ./chart-dir/web-app helm template . -x templates/deployment.yaml
title: Helm

content:
Kubectl commands
kubectl get pods -A -o wide kubectl run -it new-image --image=alpine kubectl get all -A kubectl top (also top pod and node) kubectl explain pod.spec --recursive kubectl api-versions kubectl auth can-i exec pods --kubeconfig=config kubectl describe pv kubectl describe pv kubectl get storageclass kubectl get apiservice https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/policy/pod-security-policy/ https://pkg.go.dev/sigs.k8s.io/cluster-api#section-readme
title: Commands

content:
Git git remote set-url --push upstream no_push git config --global credential.helper osxkeychain git whatchanged -p --since="1 week ago" OpenSSL openssl req x509 -newkey rsa:4096 -keyout key.pem -out cert.pem -days 365 -nodes openssl genrsa -des3 -out rootCA.key 4096 Check cert belongs to private key
openssl x509 -noout -modulus -in CERTIFICATE.crt | openssl md5 openssl req -noout -modulus -in CSR.csr | openssl md5 openssl rsa -noout -modulus -in PRIVATEKEY.key | openssl md5 Random https://www.gnu.org/software/sed/manual/html_node/Multiline-techniques.html hugo new --kind chapter Code/_index.md hugo new AWS/EKS.md socat -d -d -d TCP4-LISTEN:8181,fork,reuseaddr TCP4:10.1.2.3:80 ssh -L 80:localhost:8080 10.1.2.3 .mode csv .import ./all_user_data.csv UserData set -eu -o pipefail # Catch unused variables, and failed command pipes
title: Commands

title: Links

content: aws ec2 describe-instances --region=eu-west-2 --filters="Name=instance-state-name,Values=running" aws s3api --region=eu-west-1 put-bucket-encrytion --bucket bucket-name --server-side-encryption-configuration '{"Rules": [ { "ApplyServerSideEncryptionByDefault": { "SSEAlgorithm": "AES256" } } ] }' aws s3api put-public-access-block \  --bucket my-bucket \  --public-access-block-configuration "BlockPublicAcls=true,IgnorePublicAcls=true,BlockPublicPolicy=true,RestrictPublicBuckets=true" aws s3api --region eu-west-1 put-bucket-tagging Tagset='[{Key=owner,Value='blah'}]' for i in $(aws s3api list-buckets | jq -r '.Buckets[].Name'); do aws s3api put-bucket-logging --bucket ${i}; done curl checkip.amazonaws.com
title: Commands
